pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.1: At one time the when Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.2: the monks from the group of six hit the monks from the group of seventeen in anger.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.6: and they told them what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.8: “How could the monks from the group of six hit other monks in anger?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.12: “Foolish men, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.14: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.15.1: ‘If a monk hits a monk in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.10: if he hits with his body, with anything connected to his body, or with anything released, even if just with a lotus leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.1: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.2: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.3: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.4: If he hits one who is not fully ordained in anger, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.5: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.6: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.7: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.3.5: The training rule on hitting, the fourth, is finished.
